question.text: Carbon dioxide is the major limiting factor for photosynthesis. With respect to this, choose the correct statement from the following.

options.text: Crops like tomato and bell pepper use increased levels of CO<sub>2</sub> for higher productivity and are hence called greenhouse crops.
The current availability of CO<sub>2</sub> levels is limiting to C<sub>4</sub> plants.
C<sub>4</sub> plants show saturation at about 450 µlL<sup>-1</sup> while C<sub>3</sub> responds to increased CO<sub>2</sub> concentration and saturation is seen only beyond 360 µlL<sup>-1</sup>.
Increase in concentration up to 0.03 per cent can cause an increase in CO<sub>2</sub> fixation rates.

solution.text:
The fact that C3 plants respond to higher CO2 concentration by showing increased rates of photosynthesis leading to higher productivity has been used for some greenhouse crops such as tomatoes and bell pepper. They are allowed to grow in a carbon dioxide enriched atmosphere that leads to higher yields.
The current availability of CO2 levels is limiting to C3 plants.
C4 plants show saturation at about 360 µlL-1 while C3 responds to increased CO2 concentration and saturation is seen only beyond 450 µlL-1.
Increase in concentration up to 0.05 per cent can cause an increase in CO2 fixation rates.
